          <chops-button>
            Got it
          </chops-button>
        <div class="edit-actions">
          <chops-button>
            Got it
          </chops-button>
        </div>
      <chops-dialog id="corpModeDialog" forced="">
        <h2>This site hosts public issues in public projects</h2>

        <p>Unlike our internal issue tracker, this site makes most
        issues public, unless the issue is labeled with a Restrict-View-*
        label, such as Restrict-View-Google.</p>

        <p>Components are not used for permissions.  And, regardless of
        restriction labels, the issue reporter, owner,
        and Cc'd users may always view the issue.</p>

        

        <div class="edit-actions">
          <chops-button>

          </chops-button>

        The following revision refers to this bug:<span class="line"><!---->The following revision refers to this bug:<!----></span><br>  <span class="line"><!---->  <!----></span>https://chromium.googlesource.com/chromium/src/+/aedd4d97491936c57c45552dfeb8ea6ea985d26d<a class="undefined" target="_blank" href="https://chromium.googlesource.com/chromium/src/+/aedd4d97491936c57c45552dfeb8ea6ea985d26d"><!---->https://chromium.googlesource.com/chromium/src/+/aedd4d97491936c57c45552dfeb8ea6ea985d26d<!----></a><br><br>commit <span class="line"><!---->commit <!----></span>aedd4d97491936c57c45552dfeb8ea6ea985d26d<a class="undefined" target="_blank" href="https://crrev.com/aedd4d97491936c57c45552dfeb8ea6ea985d26d"><!---->aedd4d97491936c57c45552dfeb8ea6ea985d26d<!----></a><br>Author: yiyix <<span class="line"><!---->Author: yiyix &lt;<!----></span>yiyix@chromium.org<a class="undefined" target="_blank" href="/u/yiyix@chromium.org"><!---->yiyix@chromium.org<!----></a>><span class="line"><!---->&gt;<!----></span><br>Date: Thu Dec 17 21:10:46 2020<span class="line"><!---->Date: Thu Dec 17 21:10:46 2020<!----></span><br><br>Fix poison address in blink::CanvasResourceHost::InitializeForRecording<span class="line"><!---->Fix poison address in blink::CanvasResourceHost::InitializeForRecording<!----></span><br><br>After allocate a large buffer in memory and creating canvas, it will<span class="line"><!---->After allocate a large buffer in memory and creating canvas, it will<!----></span><br>trigger the garbage collection from v8, which will trigger<span class="line"><!---->trigger the garbage collection from v8, which will trigger<!----></span><br>HtmlCanvasElement::Dispose to be called. This call will cause the<span class="line"><!---->HtmlCanvasElement::Dispose to be called. This call will cause the<!----></span><br>canvas element detached from the |host|. However the |host| is saved<span class="line"><!---->canvas element detached from the |host|. However the |host| is saved<!----></span><br>as a valid callback in the observer list of the canvas resource<span class="line"><!---->as a valid callback in the observer list of the canvas resource<!----></span><br>provider. Calling this |host| without canvas element causes this access<span class="line"><!---->provider. Calling this |host| without canvas element causes this access<!----></span><br>to poison address.<span class="line"><!---->to poison address.<!----></span><br><br>In my fix, after garbage collection is triggered and dispose is called,<span class="line"><!---->In my fix, after garbage collection is triggered and dispose is called,<!----></span><br>DiscardResourceProvider() is called as well, so it removes itself from<span class="line"><!---->DiscardResourceProvider() is called as well, so it removes itself from<!----></span><br>the observer list.<span class="line"><!---->the observer list.<!----></span><br><br>Bug: 1158266<a class="strike-through" target="_blank" href="/p/chromium/issues/detail?id=1158266" title="uaf in  use-after-poison in blink::CanvasResourceHost::InitializeForRecording(canvas_resource_host.cc)"><!---->Bug: 1158266<!----></a><br><br>Change-Id: I40bfc24ff5dcdb7a248114220100b6dd54ac06f4<span class="line"><!---->Change-Id: I40bfc24ff5dcdb7a248114220100b6dd54ac06f4<!----></span><br>Reviewed-on: <span class="line"><!---->Reviewed-on: <!----></span>https://chromium-review.googlesource.com/c/chromium/src/+/2595734<a class="undefined" target="_blank"         The following revision refers to this bug:<span class="line"><!---->The following revision refers to this bug:<!----></span><br>  <span class="line"><!---->  <!----></span>https://chromium.googlesource.com/chromium/src/+/64cdb99ce66bcb3919eb981d432b9eac06c4eb0a<a class="undefined" target="_blank" href="https://chromium.googlesource.com/chromium/src/+/64cdb99ce66bcb3919eb981d432b9eac06c4eb0a"><!---->https://chromium.googlesource.com/chromium/src/+/64cdb99ce66bcb3919eb981d432b9eac06c4eb0a<!----></a><br><br>commit <span class="line"><!---->commit <!----></span>64cdb99ce66bcb3919eb981d432b9eac06c4eb0a<a class="undefined" target="_blank" href="https://crrev.com/64cdb99ce66bcb3919eb981d432b9eac06c4eb0a"><!---->64cdb99ce66bcb3919eb981d432b9eac06c4eb0a<!----></a><br>Author: yiyix <<span class="line"><!---->Author: yiyix &lt;<!----></span>yiyix@chromium.org<a class="undefined" target="_blank" href="/u/yiyix@chromium.org"><!---->yiyix@chromium.org<!----></a>><span class="line"><!---->&gt;<!----></span><br>Date: Tue Dec 22 06:45:18 2020<span class="line"><!---->Date: Tue Dec 22 06:45:18 2020<!----></span><br><br>Fix poison address in blink::CanvasResourceHost::InitializeForRecording<span class="line"><!---->Fix poison address in blink::CanvasResourceHost::InitializeForRecording<!----></span><br><br>After allocate a large buffer in memory and creating canvas, it will<span class="line"><!---->After allocate a large buffer in memory and creating canvas, it will<!----></span><br>trigger the garbage collection from v8, which will trigger<span class="line"><!---->trigger the garbage collection from v8, which will trigger<!----></span><br>HtmlCanvasElement::Dispose to be called. This call will cause the<span class="line"><!---->HtmlCanvasElement::Dispose to be called. This call will cause the<!----></span><br>canvas element detached from the |host|. However the |host| is saved<span class="line"><!---->canvas element detached from the |host|. However the |host| is saved<!----></span><br>as a valid callback in the observer list of the canvas resource<span class="line"><!---->as a valid callback in the observer list of the canvas resource<!----></span><br>provider. Calling this |host| without canvas element causes this access<span class="line"><!---->provider. Calling this |host| without canvas element causes this access<!----></span><br>to poison address.<span class="line"><!---->to poison address.<!----></span><br><br>In my fix, after garbage collection is triggered and dispose is called,<span class="line"><!---->In my fix, after garbage collection is triggered and dispose is called,<!----></span><br>DiscardResourceProvider() is called as well, so it removes itself from<span class="line"><!---->DiscardResourceProvider() is called as well, so it removes itself from<!----></span><br>the observer list.<span class="line"><!---->the observer list.<!----></span><br><br>TBR=<span class="line"><!---->TBR=<!----></span>jbroman@chromium.org<a class="undefined" target="_blank" href="/u/jbroman@chromium.org"><!---->jbroman@chromium.org<!----></a><br><br>Bug: 1158266<a class="strike-through" target="_blank" href="/p/chromium/issues/detail?id=1158266" title="uaf in  use-after-poison in blink::CanvasResourceHost::InitializeForRecording(canvas_resource_host.cc)"><!---->Bug: 1158266<!----></a><br><br>(cherry picked from commit <span class="line"><!---->(cherry picked from commit <!----></span>aedd4d97491936c57c45552dfeb8ea6ea985d26d<a class="undefined" target="_blank"         *** Boilerplate reminders! ***<span class="line"><!---->*** Boilerplate reminders! ***<!----></span><br>Please do NOT publicly disclose details until a fix has been released to all our users. Early public disclosure may cancel the provisional reward. Also, please be considerate about disclosure when the bug affects a core library that may be used by other products. Please do NOT share this information with third parties who are not directly involved in fixing the bug. Doing so may cancel the provisional reward. Please be honest if you have already disclosed anything publicly or to third parties. Lastly, we understand that some of you are not interested in money. We offer the option to donate your reward to an eligible charity. If you prefer this option, let us know and we will also match your donation - subject to our discretion. Any rewards that are unclaimed after 12 months will be donated to a charity of our choosing.<span class="line"><!---->Please do NOT publicly disclose details until a fix has been released to all our users. Early public disclosure may cancel the provisional reward. Also, please be considerate about disclosure when the bug affects a core library that may be used by other products. Please do NOT share this information with third parties who are not directly involved in fixing the bug. Doing so may cancel the provisional reward. Please be honest if you have already disclosed anything publicly or to third parties. Lastly, we understand that some of you are not interested in money. We offer the option to donate your reward to an eligible charity. If you prefer this option, let us know and we will also match your donation - subject to our discretion. Any rewards that are unclaimed after 12 months will be donated to a charity of our choosing.<!----></span><br><br>Please contact <span class="line"><!---->Please contact <!----></span>security-vrp@chromium.org<a class="undefined" target="_blank" href="mailto:security-vrp@chromium.org"><!---->security-vrp@chromium.org<!----></a> with any questions.<span class="line"><!----> with any questions.<!----></span><br>******************************<span class="line"><!---->******************************<!----></span><mr-comment-content></mr-comment-content>
        
          
        <div>
          
        </div>
      <div class="comment-body">
        <mr-comment-content></mr-comment-content>
        <div>
          
        </div>
      </div>

    <mr-error hidden=""><!----><!----></mr-error>
        
          
       Note: Avoiding 2-way data binding to futureproof this code
        for LitElement. 
      <input id="checkbox" type="checkbox">
      
        <slot></slot>
      <label for="checkbox">
        <slot></slot>
      </label>
    Send email<chops-checkbox id="sendEmail">Send email</chops-checkbox>
          
            
      
        <slot></slot>
      <button>
        <slot></slot>
      </button>
    
              Discard
            <chops-button id="discard" class="de-emphasized">
              Discard
            </chops-button>
            
      
        <slot></slot>
      <button>
        <slot></slot>
      </button>
    
              Save changes
            <chops-button id="save" class="emphasized">
              Save changes
            </chops-button>
          <div>
            <chops-button id="discard" class="de-emphasized">
              Discard
            </chops-button>
            <chops-button id="save" class="emphasized">
              Save changes
            </chops-button>
          </div>
        <div class="edit-controls">
          <chops-checkbox id="sendEmail">Send email</chops-checkbox>
          <div>
            <chops-button id="discard" class="de-emphasized">
              Discard
            </chops-button>
            <chops-button id="save" class="emphasized">
              Save changes
            </chops-button>
          </div>

        /*
         * Really specific class names are necessary because ShadowDOM
         * is disabled for this component.
         */
        .chops-autocomplete-container {
          position: relative;
        }
        .chops-autocomplete-container table {
          padding: 0;
          font-size: var(--chops-main-font-size);
          color: var(--chops-link-color);
          position: absolute;
          background: var(--chops-white);
          border: var(--chops-accessible-border);
          z-index: 999;
          box-shadow: 2px 3px 8px 0px hsla(0, 0%, 0%, 0.3);
          border-spacing: 0;
          border-collapse: collapse;
          /* In the case when the autocomplete extends the
           * height of the viewport, we want to make sure
           * there's spacing. */
          margin-bottom: 1em;
        }
        .chops-autocomplete-container tbody {
          display: block;
          min-width: 100px;
          max-height: 500px;
          overflow: auto;
        }
        .chops-autocomplete-container tr {
          cursor: pointer;
          transition: background 0.2s ease-in-out;
        }
        .chops-autocomplete-container tr[data-selected] {
          background: var(--chops-active-choice-bg);
          text-decoration: underline;
        }
        .chops-autocomplete-container td {
          padding: 0.25em 8px;
          white-space: nowrap;
        }
        .screenreader-hidden {
          clip: rect(1px, 1px, 1px, 1px);
          height: 1px;
          overflow: hidden;
          position: absolute;
          white-space: nowrap;
          width: 1px;
        }

        for LitElement.

      <style>
        mr-issue-page {

        }

        }

          --mr-toggled-font-family: Monospace;
        }
        .container-issue {
          width: 100%;
          flex-direction: column;
          align-items: stretch;
          justify-content: flex-start;

          width: 100%;

          padding: 0;

          justify-content: space-between;
          flex-direction: row;
          flex-wrap: no-wrap;

          font-size: var(--chops-main-font-size);
          background: var(--monorail-metadata-toggled-bg);
          border-right: var(--chops-normal-border);
          border-bottom: var(--chops-normal-border);
          width: 24em;
          min-width: 256px;
          flex-grow: 0;

            width: 100%;
            padding: 0;
            border: 0;
          }
        }

          }

    <mr-app loginurl="https://accounts.google.com/AccountChooser?continue=https%3A%2F%2Fuc.appengine.google.com%2F_ah%2Fconflogin%3Fcontinue%3Dhttps%253A%252F%252Fbugs.chromium.org%252Fp%252Fchromium%252Fissues%252Fdetail%253Fid%253D1158266%2526q%253Dlabel%25253Aexternal_security_report%2526can%253D1%2526start%253D5300" logouturl="https://bugs.chromium.org/_ah/logout?continue=https://accounts.google.com/Logout%3Fcontinue%3Dhttps://uc.appengine.google.com/_ah/logout%253Fcontinue%253Dhttps://www.google.com/url%25253Fsa%25253DD%252526q%25253Dhttps://bugs.chromium.org/p/chromium/issues/detail%2525253Fid%2525253D1158266%25252526q%2525253Dlabel%252525253Aexternal_security_report%25252526can%2525253D1%25252526start%2525253D5300%252526ust%25253D1703414374426279%252526usg%25253DAOvVaw05b6XmABXGYzbLcsN6teG8%26service%3Dah" versionbase="https://61906-5c6a57f-dot-monorail-prod.appspot.com" projectalert=""><!---->
      <style>
        
  :host {
    --mr-edit-field-padding: 0.125em 4px;
    --mr-edit-field-width: 90%;
    --mr-input-grid-gap: 6px;
    font-family: var(--chops-font-family);
    color: var(--chops-primary-font-color);
    font-size: var(--chops-main-font-size);
  }
  /** Converts a <button> to look like an <a> tag. */
  .linkify {
    display: inline;
    padding: 0;
    margin: 0;
    border: 0;
    background: 0;
    cursor: pointer;
  }
  h1, h2, h3, h4 {
    background: none;
  }
  a, chops-button, a.button, .button, .linkify {
    color: var(--chops-link-color);
    text-decoration: none;
    font-weight: var(--chops-link-font-weight);
    font-family: var(--chops-font-family);
  }
  a:hover, .linkify:hover {
    text-decoration: underline;
  }
  a.button, .button {
    /* Links that look like buttons. */
    display: inline-flex;
    align-items: center;
    justify-content: center;
    text-decoration: none;
    transition: filter 0.3s ease-in-out, box-shadow 0.3s ease-in-out;
  }
  a.button:hover, .button:hover {
    filter: brightness(95%);
  }
  chops-button, a.button, .button {
    box-sizing: border-box;
    font-size: var(--chops-main-font-size);
    background: var(--chops-white);
    border-radius: 6px;
    --chops-button-padding: 0.25em 8px;
    margin: 0;
    margin-left: auto;
  }
  a.button, .button {
    padding: var(--chops-button-padding);
  }
  chops-button i.material-icons, a.button i.material-icons, .button i.material-icons {
    display: block;
    margin-right: 4px;
  }
  chops-button.emphasized, a.button.emphasized, .button.emphasized {
    background: var(--chops-primary-button-bg);
    color: var(--chops-primary-button-color);
    text-shadow: 1px 1px 3px hsla(0, 0%, 0%, 0.25);
  }
  textarea, select, input {
    box-sizing: border-box;
    font-size: var(--chops-main-font-size);
  }
  /* Note: decoupling heading levels from styles is useful for
  * accessibility because styles will not always line up with semantically
  * appropriate heading levels.
  */
  .medium-heading {
    font-size: var(--chops-large-font-size);
    font-weight: normal;
    line-height: 1;
    padding: 0.25em 0;
    color: var(--chops-link-color);
    margin: 0;
    margin-top: 0.25em;
    border-bottom: var(--chops-normal-border);
  }
  .medium-heading chops-button {
    line-height: 1.6;
  }
  .input-grid {
    padding: 0.5em 0;
    display: grid;
    max-width: 100%;
    grid-gap: var(--mr-input-grid-gap);
    grid-template-columns: minmax(120px, max-content) 1fr;
    align-items: flex-start;
  }
  .input-grid label {
    font-weight: bold;
    text-align: right;
    word-wrap: break-word;
  }
  @media (max-width: 600px) {
    .input-grid label {
      margin-top: var(--mr-input-grid-gap);
      text-align: left;
    }
    .input-grid {
      grid-gap: var(--mr-input-grid-gap);
      grid-template-columns: 100%;
    }
  }

        mr-app {
          display: block;
          padding-top: var(--monorail-header-height);
          margin-top: -1px; /* Prevent a double border from showing up. */

          /* From shared-styles.js. */
          --mr-edit-field-padding: 0.125em 4px;
          --mr-edit-field-width: 90%;

          font-family: var(--chops-font-family);

        }
        main {
          border-top: var(--chops-normal-border);
        }

          align-items: flex-start;
          z-index: 1000;
        }
        /** Unfix <chops-snackbar> to allow stacking. */
        chops-snackbar {
          position: static;

          background: var(--chops-orange-50);

  :host {
    --mr-edit-field-padding: 0.125em 4px;
    --mr-edit-field-width: 90%;
    --mr-input-grid-gap: 6px;
    font-family: var(--chops-font-family);
    color: var(--chops-primary-font-color);
    font-size: var(--chops-main-font-size);
  }
  /** Converts a <button> to look like an <a> tag. */
  .linkify {
    display: inline;
    padding: 0;
    margin: 0;
    border: 0;
    background: 0;
    cursor: pointer;
  }
  h1, h2, h3, h4 {
    background: none;
  }
  a, chops-button, a.button, .button, .linkify {
    color: var(--chops-link-color);
    text-decoration: none;
    font-weight: var(--chops-link-font-weight);
    font-family: var(--chops-font-family);
  }
  a:hover, .linkify:hover {
    text-decoration: underline;
  }
  a.button, .button {
    /* Links that look like buttons. */
    display: inline-flex;
    align-items: center;
    justify-content: center;
    text-decoration: none;
    transition: filter 0.3s ease-in-out, box-shadow 0.3s ease-in-out;
  }
  a.button:hover, .button:hover {
    filter: brightness(95%);
  }
  chops-button, a.button, .button {
    box-sizing: border-box;
    font-size: var(--chops-main-font-size);
    background: var(--chops-white);
    border-radius: 6px;
    --chops-button-padding: 0.25em 8px;
    margin: 0;
    margin-left: auto;
  }
  a.button, .button {
    padding: var(--chops-button-padding);
  }
  chops-button i.material-icons, a.button i.material-icons, .button i.material-icons {
    display: block;
    margin-right: 4px;
  }
  chops-button.emphasized, a.button.emphasized, .button.emphasized {
    background: var(--chops-primary-button-bg);
    color: var(--chops-primary-button-color);
    text-shadow: 1px 1px 3px hsla(0, 0%, 0%, 0.25);
  }
  textarea, select, input {
    box-sizing: border-box;
    font-size: var(--chops-main-font-size);
  }
  /* Note: decoupling heading levels from styles is useful for
  * accessibility because styles will not always line up with semantically
  * appropriate heading levels.
  */
  .medium-heading {
    font-size: var(--chops-large-font-size);
    font-weight: normal;
    line-height: 1;
    padding: 0.25em 0;
    color: var(--chops-link-color);
    margin: 0;
    margin-top: 0.25em;
    border-bottom: var(--chops-normal-border);
  }
  .medium-heading chops-button {
    line-height: 1.6;
  }
  .input-grid {
    padding: 0.5em 0;
    display: grid;
    max-width: 100%;
    grid-gap: var(--mr-input-grid-gap);
    grid-template-columns: minmax(120px, max-content) 1fr;
    align-items: flex-start;
  }
  .input-grid label {
    font-weight: bold;
    text-align: right;
    word-wrap: break-word;
  }
  @media (max-width: 600px) {
    .input-grid label {
      margin-top: var(--mr-input-grid-gap);
      text-align: left;
    }
    .input-grid {
      grid-gap: var(--mr-input-grid-gap);
      grid-template-columns: 100%;
    }
  }

          display: block;

        mr-issue-page {
          --mr-issue-page-horizontal-padding: 12px;
          --mr-toggled-font-family: inherit;
          --monorail-metadata-toggled-bg: var(--monorail-metadata-open-bg);
        }
        mr-issue-page[issueClosed] {
          --monorail-metadata-toggled-bg: var(--monorail-metadata-closed-bg);
        }
        mr-issue-page[codeFont] {
          --mr-toggled-font-family: Monospace;
        }
        .container-issue {
          width: 100%;
          flex-direction: column;
          align-items: stretch;
          justify-content: flex-start;
          z-index: 200;
        }
        .container-issue-content {
          padding: 0;
          flex-grow: 1;
          display: flex;
          align-items: stretch;
          justify-content: space-between;
          flex-direction: row;
          flex-wrap: nowrap;
          box-sizing: border-box;
          padding-top: 0.5em;
        }
        .container-outside {
          box-sizing: border-box;
          width: 100%;
          max-width: 100%;
          margin: auto;
          padding: 0;
          display: flex;
          align-items: stretch;
          justify-content: space-between;
          flex-direction: row;
          flex-wrap: no-wrap;
        }
        .container-no-issue {
          padding: 0.5em 16px;
          font-size: var(--chops-large-font-size);
        }
        .metadata-container {
          font-size: var(--chops-main-font-size);
          background: var(--monorail-metadata-toggled-bg);
          border-right: var(--chops-normal-border);
          border-bottom: var(--chops-normal-border);
          width: 24em;
          min-width: 256px;
          flex-grow: 0;
          flex-shrink: 0;
          box-sizing: border-box;
          z-index: 100;
        }
        .issue-header-container {
          z-index: 10;
          position: sticky;
          top: var(--monorail-header-height);
          margin-bottom: 0.25em;
          width: 100%;
        }
        mr-issue-details {
          min-width: 50%;
          max-width: 1000px;
          flex-grow: 1;
          box-sizing: border-box;
          min-height: 100%;
          padding-left: var(--mr-issue-page-horizontal-padding);
          padding-right: var(--mr-issue-page-horizontal-padding);
        }
        mr-issue-metadata {
          position: sticky;
          overflow-y: auto;
          top: var(--monorail-header-height);
          height: calc(100vh - var(--monorail-header-height));
        }
        mr-launch-overview {
          border-left: var(--chops-normal-border);
          padding-left: var(--mr-issue-page-horizontal-padding);
          padding-right: var(--mr-issue-page-horizontal-padding);
          flex-grow: 0;
          flex-shrink: 0;
          width: 50%;
          box-sizing: border-box;
          min-height: 100%;
        }
        @media (max-width: 1126px) {
          .container-issue-content {
            flex-direction: column;
            padding: 0 var(--mr-issue-page-horizontal-padding);
          }
          mr-issue-details, mr-launch-overview {
            width: 100%;
            padding: 0;
            border: 0;
          }
        }
        @media (max-width: 840px) {
          .container-outside {
            flex-direction: column;
          }
          .metadata-container {
            width: 100%;
            height: auto;
            border: 0;
            border-bottom: var(--chops-normal-border);
          }
          mr-issue-metadata {
            min-width: auto;
            max-width: auto;
            width: 100%;
            padding: 0;
            min-height: 0;
            border: 0;
          }
          mr-issue-metadata, .issue-header-container {
            position: static;
          }
        }

        Email display settings<h2>Email display settings</h2>

        There is a setting<a href="/hosting/settings">setting</a> to control how
        your email address appears on comments and issues that you post.<p>There is a <a href="/hosting/settings">setting</a> to control how
        your email address appears on comments and issues that you post.</p>

        Project members will always see your full email address.  By
        default, other users who visit the site will see an
        abbreviated version of your email address.<p>Project members will always see your full email address.  By
        default, other users who visit the site will see an
        abbreviated version of your email address.</p>

        If you do not wish your email address to be shared, there
        are other ways to get
        involved<a href="http://www.chromium.org/getting-involved">get
        involved</a> in the community.  To report a problem when using
        the Chrome browser, you may use the "Report an issue..."  item
        on the "Help" menu.<p>If you do not wish your email address to be shared, there
        are other ways to <a href="http://www.chromium.org/getting-involved">get
        involved</a> in the community.  To report a problem when using
        the Chrome browser, you may use the "Report an issue..."  item
        on the "Help" menu.</p>


        
          
      
        <slot></slot>
      <button>
        <slot></slot>
      </button>
    
            Got it
          <chops-button>
            Got it
          </chops-button>
        <div class="edit-actions">
          <chops-button>
            Got it
          </chops-button>
        </div>
      <chops-dialog id="privacyDialog" forced="">
        <h2>Email display settings</h2>

        <p>There is a <a href="/hosting/settings">setting</a> to control how
        your email address appears on comments and issues that you post.</p>

        <p>Project members will always see your full email address.  By
        default, other users who visit the site will see an
        abbreviated version of your email address.</p>

        <p>If you do not wish your email address to be shared, there
        are other ways to <a href="http://www.chromium.org/getting-involved">get
        involved</a> in the community.  To report a problem when using
        the Chrome browser, you may use the "Report an issue..."  item
        on the "Help" menu.</p>


        <div class="edit-actions">
          <chops-button>
            Got it
          </chops-button>
        </div>
      </chops-dialog>

      
      
        
          <slot></slot>
        <div class="dialog-content">
          <slot></slot>
        </div>
      <dialog class="dialog" role="dialog">
        <div class="dialog-content">
          <slot></slot>
        </div>
      </dialog>
    
        This site hosts public issues in public projects<h2>This site hosts public issues in public projects</h2>

        Unlike our internal issue tracker, this site makes most
        issues public, unless the issue is labeled with a Restrict-View-*
        label, such as Restrict-View-Google.<p>Unlike our internal issue tracker, this site makes most
        issues public, unless the issue is labeled with a Restrict-View-*
        label, such as Restrict-View-Google.</p>

        Components are not used for permissions.  And, regardless of
        restriction labels, the issue reporter, owner,
        and Cc'd users may always view the issue.<p>Components are not used for permissions.  And, regardless of
        restriction labels, the issue reporter, owner,
        and Cc'd users may always view the issue.</p>

        

        
          
      
        <slot></slot>
      <button>
        <slot></slot>
      </button>
    
            Got it
          <chops-button>
            Got it
          </chops-button>
        <div class="edit-actions">
          <chops-button>
            Got it
          </chops-button>
        </div>
      <chops-dialog id="corpModeDialog" forced="">
        <h2>This site hosts public issues in public projects</h2>

        <p>Unlike our internal issue tracker, this site makes most
        issues public, unless the issue is labeled with a Restrict-View-*
        label, such as Restrict-View-Google.</p>

        <p>Components are not used for permissions.  And, regardless of
        restriction labels, the issue reporter, owner,
        and Cc'd users may always view the issue.</p>

        

        <div class="edit-actions">
          <chops-button>
            Got it
          </chops-button>
        </div>
      </chops-dialog>

            Issue 1158266: uaf in  use-after-poison in blink::CanvasResourceHost::InitializeForRecording(canvas_resource_host.cc)
          <h1>

          </h1>
          
            Reported by
            
      <link href="https://fonts.googleapis.com/icon?family=Material+Icons" rel="stylesheet">
      schedule<i id="availability-icon" class="material-icons inline-icon ${user.last_visit_timestamp ? '': 'inline-icon-unseen'}" title="undefined" hidden="">schedule</i>
      emily...@gmail.com<a id="user-link" href="/u/613141512" title="emily...@gmail.com"><!---->emily...@gmail.com<!----></a>
      emily...@gmail.com<span id="user-text" hidden=""><!---->emily...@gmail.com<!----></span>
      <div id="availability-text" class="availability-notice" title="undefined" hidden=""><!----><!----></div>
    <mr-user-link aria-label="issue reporter"></mr-user-link>
            on 
      Mon, Dec 14, 2020, 12:21 AM EST
    <chops-timestamp title="Mon, Dec 14, 2020, 12:21 AM EST"></chops-timestamp>

        <div class="main-text">
          <h1>
            
            Issue 1158266: uaf in  use-after-poison in blink::CanvasResourceHost::InitializeForRecording(canvas_resource_host.cc)
          </h1>

      <div class="main-text-outer">
        <div class="main-text">
          <h1>
            
            Issue 1158266: uaf in  use-after-poison in blink::CanvasResourceHost::InitializeForRecording(canvas_resource_host.cc)
          </h1>

order:       f6<span class="line"><!---->  Global init order:       f6<!----></span><br>  Poisoned by user:        f7<span class="line"><!---->  Poisoned by user:        f7<!----></span><br>  Container overflow:      fc<span class="line"><!---->  Container overflow:      fc<!----></span><br>  Array cookie:            ac<span class="line"><!---->  Array cookie:            ac<!----></span><br>  Intra object redzone:    bb<span class="line"><!---->  Intra object redzone:    bb<!----></span><br>  ASan internal:           fe<span class="line"><!---->  ASan internal:         The following revision refers to this bug:<span class="line"><!---->The following revision refers to this bug:<!----></span><br>  <span class="line"><!---->  <!----></span>https://chromium.googlesource.com/chromium/src/+/aedd4d97491936c57c45552dfeb8ea6ea985d26d<a class="undefined" target="_blank" href="https://chromium.googlesource.com/chromium/src/+/aedd4d97491936c57c45552dfeb8ea6ea985d26d"><!---->https://chromium.googlesource.com/chromium/src/+/aedd4d97491936c57c45552dfeb8ea6ea985d26d<!----></a><br><br>commit <span class="line"><!---->commit <!----></span>aedd4d97491936c57c45552dfeb8ea6ea985d26d<a class="undefined" target="_blank" href="https://crrev.com/aedd4d97491936c57c45552dfeb8ea6ea985d26d"><!---->aedd4d97491936c57c45552dfeb8ea6ea985d26d<!----></a><br>Author: yiyix <<span class="line"><!---->Author: yiyix &lt;<!----></span>yiyix@chromium.org<a class="undefined" target="_blank" href="/u/yiyix@chromium.org"><!---->yiyix@chromium.org<!----></a>><span class="line"><!---->&gt;<!----></span><br>Date: Thu Dec 17 21:10:46 2020<span class="line"><!---->Date: Thu Dec 17 21:10:46 2020<!----></span><br><br>Fix poison address in blink::CanvasResourceHost::InitializeForRecording<span class="line"><!---->Fix poison address in blink::CanvasResourceHost::InitializeForRecording<!----></span><br><br>After allocate a large buffer in memory and creating canvas, it will<span class="line"><!---->After allocate a large buffer in memory and creating canvas, it will<!----></span><br>trigger the garbage collection from v8, which will trigger<span class="line"><!---->trigger the garbage collection from v8, which will trigger<!----></span><br>HtmlCanvasElement::Dispose to be called. This call will cause the<span class="line"><!---->HtmlCanvasElement::Dispose to be called. This call will cause the<!----></span><br>canvas element detached from the |host|. However the |host| is saved<span class="line"><!---->canvas element detached from the |host|. However the |host| is saved<!----></span><br>as a valid callback in the observer list of the canvas resource<span class="line"><!---->as a valid callback in the observer list of the canvas resource<!----></span><br>provider. Calling this |host| without canvas element causes this access<span class="line"><!---->provider. Calling this |host| without canvas element causes this access<!----></span><br>to poison address.<span class="line"><!---->to poison address.<!----></span><br><br>In my fix, after garbage collection is triggered and dispose is called,<span class="line"><!---->In my fix, after garbage collection is triggered and dispose is called,<!----></span><br>DiscardResourceProvider() is called as well, so it removes itself from<span class="line"><!---->DiscardResourceProvider() is called as well, so it removes itself from<!----></span><br>the observer list.<span class="line"><!---->the observer list.<!----></span><br><br>Bug: 1158266<a class="strike-through" target="_blank" href="/p/chromium/issues/detail?id=1158266" title="uaf in  use-after-poison in blink::CanvasResourceHost::InitializeForRecording(canvas_resource_host.cc)"><!---->Bug: 1158266<!----></a><br><br>Change-Id: I40bfc24ff5dcdb7a248114220100b6dd54ac06f4<span class="line"><!---->Change-Id: I40bfc24ff5dcdb7a248114220100b6dd54ac06f4<!----></span><br>Reviewed-on: <span class="line"><!---->Reviewed-on:         The following revision refers to this bug:<span class="line"><!---->The following revision refers to this bug:<!----></span><br>  <span class="line"><!---->  <!----></span>https://chromium.googlesource.com/chromium/src/+/64cdb99ce66bcb3919eb981d432b9eac06c4eb0a<a class="undefined" target="_blank" href="https://chromium.googlesource.com/chromium/src/+/64cdb99ce66bcb3919eb981d432b9eac06c4eb0a"><!---->https://chromium.googlesource.com/chromium/src/+/64cdb99ce66bcb3919eb981d432b9eac06c4eb0a<!----></a><br><br>commit <span class="line"><!---->commit <!----></span>64cdb99ce66bcb3919eb981d432b9eac06c4eb0a<a class="undefined" target="_blank" href="https://crrev.com/64cdb99ce66bcb3919eb981d432b9eac06c4eb0a"><!---->64cdb99ce66bcb3919eb981d432b9eac06c4eb0a<!----></a><br>Author: yiyix <<span class="line"><!---->Author: yiyix &lt;<!----></span>yiyix@chromium.org<a class="undefined" target="_blank" href="/u/yiyix@chromium.org"><!---->yiyix@chromium.org<!----></a>><span class="line"><!---->&gt;<!----></span><br>Date: Tue Dec 22 06:45:18 2020<span class="line"><!---->Date: Tue Dec 22 06:45:18 2020<!----></span><br><br>Fix poison address in blink::CanvasResourceHost::InitializeForRecording<span class="line"><!---->Fix poison address in blink::CanvasResourceHost::InitializeForRecording<!----></span><br><br>After allocate a large buffer in memory and creating canvas, it will<span class="line"><!---->After allocate a large buffer in memory and creating canvas, it will<!----></span><br>trigger the garbage collection from v8, which will trigger<span class="line"><!---->trigger the garbage collection from v8, which will trigger<!----></span><br>HtmlCanvasElement::Dispose to be called. This call will cause the<span class="line"><!---->HtmlCanvasElement::Dispose to be called. This call will cause the<!----></span><br>canvas element detached from the |host|. However the |host| is saved<span class="line"><!---->canvas element detached from the |host|. However the |host| is saved<!----></span><br>as a valid callback in the observer list of the canvas resource<span class="line"><!---->as a valid callback in the observer list of the canvas resource<!----></span><br>provider. Calling this |host| without canvas element causes this access<span class="line"><!---->provider. Calling this |host| without canvas element causes this access<!----></span><br>to poison address.<span class="line"><!---->to poison address.<!----></span><br><br>In my fix, after garbage collection is triggered and dispose is called,<span class="line"><!---->In my fix, after garbage collection is triggered and dispose is called,<!----></span><br>DiscardResourceProvider() is called as well, so it removes itself from<span class="line"><!---->DiscardResourceProvider() is called as well, so it removes itself from<!----></span><br>the observer list.<span class="line"><!---->the observer list.<!----></span><br><br>TBR=<span class="line"><!---->TBR=<!----></span>jbroman@chromium.org<a class="undefined" target="_blank" href="/u/jbroman@chromium.org"><!---->jbroman@chromium.org<!----></a><br><br>Bug: 1158266<a class="strike-through" target="_blank" href="/p/chromium/issues/detail?id=1158266" title="uaf in  use-after-poison in blink::CanvasResourceHost::InitializeForRecording(canvas_resource_host.cc)"><!---->Bug: 1158266<!----></a><br><br>(cherry picked from commit <span class="line"><!---->(cherry picked from commit <!----></span>aedd4d97491936c57c45552dfeb8ea6ea985d26d<a class="undefined" target="_blank"         *** Boilerplate reminders! ***<span class="line"><!---->*** Boilerplate reminders! ***<!----></span><br>Please do NOT publicly disclose details until a fix has been released to all our users. Early public disclosure may cancel the provisional reward. Also, please be considerate about disclosure when the bug affects a core library that may be used by other products. Please do NOT share this information with third parties who are not directly involved in fixing the bug. Doing so may cancel the provisional reward. Please be honest if you have already disclosed anything publicly or to third parties. Lastly, we understand that some of you are not interested in money. We offer the option to donate your reward to an eligible charity. If you prefer this option, let us know and we will also match your donation - subject to our discretion. Any rewards that are unclaimed after 12 months will be donated to a charity of our choosing.<span class="line"><!---->Please do NOT publicly disclose details until a fix has been released to all our users. Early public disclosure may cancel the provisional reward. Also, please be considerate about disclosure when the bug affects a core library that may be used by other products. Please do NOT share this information with third parties who are not directly involved in fixing the bug. Doing so may cancel the provisional reward. Please be honest if you have already disclosed anything publicly or to third parties. Lastly, we understand that some of you are not interested in money. We offer the option to donate your reward to an eligible charity. If you prefer this option, let us know and we will also match your donation - subject to our discretion. Any rewards that are unclaimed after 12 months will be donated to a charity of our choosing.<!----></span><br><br>Please contact <span class="line"><!---->Please contact <!----></span>security-vrp@chromium.org<a class="undefined" target="_blank" href="mailto:security-vrp@chromium.org"><!---->security-vrp@chromium.org<!----></a> with any questions.<span class="line"><!----> with any questions.<!----></span><br>******************************<span class="line"><!---->******************************<!----></span><mr-comment-content></mr-comment-content>

        Hello OP/emilykim@, we consider attachments/pocs included with reports to be an integral part of the report (<span class="line"><!---->Hello OP/emilykim@, we consider attachments/pocs included with reports to be an integral part of the report (<!----></span>https://bughunters.google.com/about/rules/5745167867576320<a class="undefined" target="_blank" href="https://bughunters.google.com/about/rules/5745167867576320"><!---->https://bughunters.google.com/about/rules/5745167867576320<!----></a>),<span class="line"><!---->),<!----></span> so I've undeleted them.            issue<h3 class="medium-heading"><!----> issue</h3>
          
            Target project:<label for="targetProjectInput">Target project:</label>
            
              <input id="targetProjectInput" aria-owns="chops-autocomplete-1" aria-autocomplete="both" aria-expanded="false" aria-haspopup="listbox" aria-activedescendant="">
              
      
        /*
         * Really specific class names are necessary because ShadowDOM
         * is disabled for this component.
         */
        .chops-autocomplete-container {
          position: relative;
        }
        .chops-autocomplete-container table {
          padding: 0;
          font-size: var(--chops-main-font-size);
          color: var(--chops-link-color);
          position: absolute;
          background: var(--chops-white);
          border: var(--chops-accessible-border);
          z-index: 999;
          box-shadow: 2px 3px 8px 0px hsla(0, 0%, 0%, 0.3);
          border-spacing: 0;
          border-collapse: collapse;
          /* In the case when the autocomplete extends the
           * height of the viewport, we want to make sure
           * there's spacing. */
          margin-bottom: 1em;
        }
        .chops-autocomplete-container tbody {
          display: block;
          min-width: 100px;
          max-height: 500px;
          overflow: auto;
        }
        .chops-autocomplete-container tr {
          cursor: pointer;
          transition: background 0.2s ease-in-out;
        }
        .chops-autocomplete-container tr[data-selected] {
          background: var(--chops-active-choice-bg);
          text-decoration: underline;
        }
        .chops-autocomplete-container td {
          padding: 0.25em 8px;
          white-space: nowrap;
        }
        .screenreader-hidden {
          clip: rect(1px, 1px, 1px, 1px);
          height: 1px;
          overflow: hidden;
          position: absolute;
          white-space: nowrap;
          width: 1px;
        }

              <input id="targetProjectInput" aria-owns="chops-autocomplete-1" aria-autocomplete="both" aria-expanded="false" aria-haspopup="listbox" aria-activedescendant="">
              <mr-autocomplete vocabularyname="project" for="targetProjectInput" role="listbox" id="chops-autocomplete-1"><!---->
      <style>
        /*
         * Really specific class names are necessary because ShadowDOM
         * is disabled for this component.
         */
        .chops-autocomplete-container {
          position: relative;
        }
        .chops-autocomplete-container table {
          padding: 0;
          font-size: var(--chops-main-font-size);
          color: var(--chops-link-color);
          position: absolute;
          background: var(--chops-white);
          border: var(--chops-accessible-border);
          z-index: 999;
          box-shadow: 2px 3px 8px 0px hsla(0, 0%, 0%, 0.3);
          border-spacing: 0;
          border-collapse: collapse;
          /* In the case when the autocomplete extends the
           * height of the viewport, we want to make sure
           * there's spacing. */
          margin-bottom: 1em;
        }
        .chops-autocomplete-container tbody {
          display: block;
          min-width: 100px;
          max-height: 500px;
          overflow: auto;
        }
        .chops-autocomplete-container tr {
          cursor: pointer;
          transition: background 0.2s ease-in-out;
        }
        .chops-autocomplete-container tr[data-selected] {
          background: var(--chops-active-choice-bg);
          text-decoration: underline;
        }
        .chops-autocomplete-container td {
          padding: 0.25em 8px;
          white-space: nowrap;
        }
        .screenreader-hidden {
          clip: rect(1px, 1px, 1px, 1px);
          height: 1px;
          overflow: hidden;
          position: absolute;
          white-space: nowrap;
          width: 1px;
        }
      </style>
      <div class="chops-autocomplete-container">
        <span class="screenreader-hidden" aria-live="polite">
          
        </span>
        <table hidden="">
          <tbody>
            
          </tbody>
        </table>
      </div>
    <!----></mr-autocomplete>
            </div>
          </div>

      </button>

         * is disabled for this component.

           * height of the viewport, we want to make sure
           * there's spacing. */

       Note: Avoiding 2-way data binding to futureproof this code
        for LitElement.

    <mr-issue-page issueclosed=""><!---->
      <style>
        mr-issue-page {
          --mr-issue-page-horizontal-padding: 12px;
          --mr-toggled-font-family: inherit;
          --monorail-metadata-toggled-bg: var(--monorail-metadata-open-bg);
        }
        mr-issue-page[issueClosed] {
          --monorail-metadata-toggled-bg: var(--monorail-metadata-closed-bg);
        }
        mr-issue-page[codeFont] {
          --mr-toggled-font-family: Monospace;
        }
        .container-issue {
          width: 100%;
          flex-direction: column;
          align-items: stretch;
          justify-content: flex-start;
          z-index: 200;
        }
        .container-issue-content {
          padding: 0;
          flex-grow: 1;
          display: flex;
          align-items: stretch;
          justify-content: space-between;
          flex-direction: row;
          flex-wrap: nowrap;
          box-sizing: border-box;
          padding-top: 0.5em;
        }
        .container-outside {
          box-sizing: border-box;
          width: 100%;
          max-width: 100%;
          margin: auto;
          padding: 0;
          display: flex;
          align-items: stretch;
          justify-content: space-between;
          flex-direction: row;
          flex-wrap: no-wrap;
        }
        .container-no-issue {
          padding: 0.5em 16px;
          font-size: var(--chops-large-font-size);
        }
        .metadata-container {
          font-size: var(--chops-main-font-size);
          background: var(--monorail-metadata-toggled-bg);
          border-right: var(--chops-normal-border);
          border-bottom: var(--chops-normal-border);
          width: 24em;
          min-width: 256px;
          flex-grow: 0;
          flex-shrink: 0;
          box-sizing: border-box;
          z-index: 100;
        }
        .issue-header-container {
          z-index: 10;
          position: sticky;
          top: var(--monorail-header-height);
          margin-bottom: 0.25em;
          width: 100%;
        }
        mr-issue-details {
          min-width: 50%;
          max-width: 1000px;
          flex-grow: 1;
          box-sizing: border-box;
          min-height: 100%;
          padding-left: var(--mr-issue-page-horizontal-padding);
          padding-right: var(--mr-issue-page-horizontal-padding);
        }
        mr-issue-metadata {
          position: sticky;
          overflow-y: auto;
          top: var(--monorail-header-height);
          height: calc(100vh - var(--monorail-header-height));
        }
        mr-launch-overview {
          border-left: var(--chops-normal-border);
          padding-left: var(--mr-issue-page-horizontal-padding);
          padding-right: var(--mr-issue-page-horizontal-padding);
          flex-grow: 0;
          flex-shrink: 0;
          width: 50%;
          box-sizing: border-box;
          min-height: 100%;
        }
        @media (max-width: 1126px) {
          .container-issue-content {
            flex-direction: column;
            padding: 0 var(--mr-issue-page-horizontal-padding);
          }
          mr-issue-details, mr-launch-overview {
            width: 100%;
            padding: 0;
            border: 0;
          }
        }
        @media (max-width: 840px) {
          .container-outside {
            flex-direction: column;
          }
          .metadata-container {
            width: 100%;
            height: auto;
            border: 0;
            border-bottom: var(--chops-normal-border);
          }
          mr-issue-metadata {
            min-width: auto;
            max-width: auto;
            width: 100%;
            padding: 0;
            min-height: 0;
            border: 0;
          }
          mr-issue-metadata, .issue-header-container {
            position: static;
          }
        }
      </style>

        Email display settings<h2>Email display settings</h2>

        There is a setting<a href="/hosting/settings">setting</a> to control how
        your email address appears on comments and issues that you post.<p>There is a <a href="/hosting/settings">setting</a> to control how
        your email address appears on comments and issues that you post.</p>

        Project members will always see your full email address.  By
        default, other users who visit the site will see an
        abbreviated version of your email address.<p>Project members will always see your full email address.  By
        default, other users who visit the site will see an
        abbreviated version of your email address.</p>

        If you do not wish your email address to be shared, there
        are other ways to get
        involved<a href="http://www.chromium.org/getting-involved">get
        involved</a> in the community.  To report a problem when using
        the Chrome browser, you may use the "Report an issue..."  item
        on the "Help" menu.<p>If you do not wish your email address to be shared, there
        are other ways to <a href="http://www.chromium.org/getting-involved">get
        involved</a> in the community.  To report a problem when using
        the Chrome browser, you may use the "Report an issue..."  item
        on the "Help" menu.</p>


        
          
      
        <slot></slot>
      <button>
        <slot></slot>
      </button>
    
            Got it
          <chops-button>
            Got it
          </chops-button>
        <div class="edit-actions">
          <chops-button>
            Got it
          </chops-button>
        </div>
      <chops-dialog id="privacyDialog" forced="">
        <h2>Email display settings</h2>

        <p>There is a <a href="/hosting/settings">setting</a> to control how
        your email address appears on comments and issues that you post.</p>

        <p>Project members will always see your full email address.  By
        default, other users who visit the site will see an
        abbreviated version of your email address.</p>

        <p>If you do not wish your email address to be shared, there
        are other ways to <a href="http://www.chromium.org/getting-involved">get
        involved</a> in the community.  To report a problem when using
        the Chrome browser, you may use the "Report an issue..."  item
        on the "Help" menu.</p>


        <div class="edit-actions">
          <chops-button>
            Got it
          </chops-button>
        </div>
      </chops-dialog>

      
      
        
          <slot></slot>
        <div class="dialog-content">
          <slot></slot>
        </div>
      <dialog class="dialog" role="dialog">
        <div class="dialog-content">
          <slot></slot>
        </div>
      </dialog>
    
        This site hosts public issues in public projects<h2>This site hosts public issues in public projects</h2>

        Unlike our internal issue tracker, this site makes most
        issues public, unless the issue is labeled with a Restrict-View-*
        label, such as Restrict-View-Google.<p>Unlike our internal issue tracker, this site makes most
        issues public, unless the issue is labeled with a Restrict-View-*
        label, such as Restrict-View-Google.</p>

        Components are not used for permissions.  And, regardless of
        restriction labels, the issue reporter, owner,
        and Cc'd users may always view the issue.<p>Components are not used for permissions.  And, regardless of
        restriction labels, the issue reporter, owner,
        and Cc'd users may always view the issue.</p>

        

        
          
      
        <slot></slot>
      <button>
        <slot></slot>
      </button>
    
            Got it
          <chops-button>
            Got it
          </chops-button>
        <div class="edit-actions">
          <chops-button>
            Got it
          </chops-button>
        </div>
      <chops-dialog id="corpModeDialog" forced="">
        <h2>This site hosts public issues in public projects</h2>

        <p>Unlike our internal issue tracker, this site makes most
        issues public, unless the issue is labeled with a Restrict-View-*
        label, such as Restrict-View-Google.</p>

        <p>Components are not used for permissions.  And, regardless of
        restriction labels, the issue reporter, owner,
        and Cc'd users may always view the issue.</p>

        

        <div class="edit-actions">
          <chops-button>
            Got it
          </chops-button>
        </div>
      </chops-dialog>

        The following revision refers to this bug:<span class="line"><!---->The following revision refers to this bug:<!----></span><br>  <span class="line"><!---->  <!----></span>https://chromium.googlesource.com/chromium/src/+/aedd4d97491936c57c45552dfeb8ea6ea985d26d<a class="undefined" target="_blank" href="https://chromium.googlesource.com/chromium/src/+/aedd4d97491936c57c45552dfeb8ea6ea985d26d"><!---->https://chromium.googlesource.com/chromium/src/+/aedd4d97491936c57c45552dfeb8ea6ea985d26d<!----></a><br><br>commit <span class="line"><!---->commit <!----></span>aedd4d97491936c57c45552dfeb8ea6ea985d26d<a class="undefined" target="_blank" href="https://crrev.com/aedd4d97491936c57c45552dfeb8ea6ea985d26d"><!---->aedd4d97491936c57c45552dfeb8ea6ea985d26d<!----></a><br>Author: yiyix <<span class="line"><!---->Author: yiyix &lt;<!----></span>yiyix@chromium.org<a class="undefined" target="_blank" href="/u/yiyix@chromium.org"><!---->yiyix@chromium.org<!----></a>><span class="line"><!---->&gt;<!----></span><br>Date: Thu Dec 17 21:10:46 2020<span class="line"><!---->Date: Thu Dec 17 21:10:46 2020<!----></span><br><br>Fix poison address in blink::CanvasResourceHost::InitializeForRecording<span class="line"><!---->Fix poison address in blink::CanvasResourceHost::InitializeForRecording<!----></span><br><br>After allocate a large buffer in memory and creating canvas, it will<span class="line"><!---->After allocate a large buffer in memory and creating canvas, it will<!----></span><br>trigger the garbage collection from v8, which will trigger<span class="line"><!---->trigger the garbage collection from v8, which will trigger<!----></span><br>HtmlCanvasElement::Dispose to be called. This call will cause the<span class="line"><!---->HtmlCanvasElement::Dispose to be called. This call will cause the<!----></span><br>canvas element detached from the |host|. However the |host| is saved<span class="line"><!---->canvas element detached from the |host|. However the |host| is saved<!----></span><br>as a valid callback in the observer list of the canvas resource<span class="line"><!---->as a valid callback in the observer list of the canvas resource<!----></span><br>provider. Calling this |host| without canvas element causes this access<span class="line"><!---->provider. Calling this |host| without canvas element causes this access<!----></span><br>to poison address.<span class="line"><!---->to poison address.<!----></span><br><br>In my fix, after garbage collection is triggered and dispose is called,<span class="line"><!---->In my fix, after garbage collection is triggered and dispose is called,<!----></span><br>DiscardResourceProvider() is called as well, so it removes itself from<span class="line"><!---->DiscardResourceProvider() is called as well, so it removes itself from<!----></span><br>the observer list.<span class="line"><!---->the observer list.<!----></span><br><br>Bug: 1158266<a class="strike-through" target="_blank" href="/p/chromium/issues/detail?id=1158266" title="uaf in  use-after-poison in blink::CanvasResourceHost::InitializeForRecording(canvas_resource_host.cc)"><!---->Bug: 1158266<!----></a><br><br>Change-Id: I40bfc24ff5dcdb7a248114220100b6dd54ac06f4<span class="line"><!---->Change-Id: I40bfc24ff5dcdb7a248114220100b6dd54ac06f4<!----></span><br>Reviewed-on: <span class="line"><!---->Reviewed-on: <!----></span>https://chromium-review.googlesource.com/c/chromium/src/+/2595734<a class="undefined" target="_blank" href="https://chromium-review.googlesource.com/c/chromium/src/+/2595734"><!---->https://chromium-review.googlesource.com/c/chromium/src/+/2595734<!----></a><br>Commit-Queue: Jeremy Roman <<span class="line"><!---->Commit-Queue: Jeremy Roman &lt;<!----></span>jbroman@chromium.org<a class="undefined" target="_blank" href="/u/jbroman@chromium.org"><!---->jbroman@chromium.org<!----></a>><span         The following revision refers to this bug:<span class="line"><!---->The following revision refers to this bug:<!----></span><br>  <span class="line"><!---->  <!----></span>https://chromium.googlesource.com/chromium/src/+/64cdb99ce66bcb3919eb981d432b9eac06c4eb0a<a class="undefined" target="_blank" href="https://chromium.googlesource.com/chromium/src/+/64cdb99ce66bcb3919eb981d432b9eac06c4eb0a"><!---->https://chromium.googlesource.com/chromium/src/+/64cdb99ce66bcb3919eb981d432b9eac06c4eb0a<!----></a><br><br>commit <span class="line"><!---->commit <!----></span>64cdb99ce66bcb3919eb981d432b9eac06c4eb0a<a class="undefined" target="_blank" href="https://crrev.com/64cdb99ce66bcb3919eb981d432b9eac06c4eb0a"><!---->64cdb99ce66bcb3919eb981d432b9eac06c4eb0a<!----></a><br>Author: yiyix <<span class="line"><!---->Author: yiyix &lt;<!----></span>yiyix@chromium.org<a class="undefined" target="_blank" href="/u/yiyix@chromium.org"><!---->yiyix@chromium.org<!----></a>><span class="line"><!---->&gt;<!----></span><br>Date: Tue Dec 22 06:45:18 2020<span class="line"><!---->Date: Tue Dec 22 06:45:18 2020<!----></span><br><br>Fix poison address in blink::CanvasResourceHost::InitializeForRecording<span class="line"><!---->Fix poison address in blink::CanvasResourceHost::InitializeForRecording<!----></span><br><br>After allocate a large buffer in memory and creating canvas, it will<span class="line"><!---->After allocate a large buffer in memory and creating canvas, it will<!----></span><br>trigger the garbage collection from v8, which will trigger<span class="line"><!---->trigger the garbage collection from v8, which will trigger<!----></span><br>HtmlCanvasElement::Dispose to be called. This call will cause the<span class="line"><!---->HtmlCanvasElement::Dispose to be called. This call will cause the<!----></span><br>canvas element detached from the |host|. However the |host| is saved<span class="line"><!---->canvas element detached from the |host|. However the |host| is saved<!----></span><br>as a valid callback in the observer list of the canvas resource<span class="line"><!---->as a valid callback in the observer list of the canvas resource<!----></span><br>provider. Calling this |host| without canvas element causes this access<span class="line"><!---->provider. Calling this |host| without canvas element causes this access<!----></span><br>to poison address.<span class="line"><!---->to poison address.<!----></span><br><br>In my fix, after garbage collection is triggered and dispose is called,<span class="line"><!---->In my fix, after garbage collection is triggered and dispose is called,<!----></span><br>DiscardResourceProvider() is called as well, so it removes itself from<span class="line"><!---->DiscardResourceProvider() is called as well, so it removes itself from<!----></span><br>the observer list.<span class="line"><!---->the observer list.<!----></span><br><br>TBR=<span class="line"><!---->TBR=<!----></span>jbroman@chromium.org<a class="undefined" target="_blank" href="/u/jbroman@chromium.org"><!---->jbroman@chromium.org<!----></a><br><br>Bug: 1158266<a class="strike-through" target="_blank" href="/p/chromium/issues/detail?id=1158266" title="uaf in  use-after-poison in blink::CanvasResourceHost::InitializeForRecording(canvas_resource_host.cc)"><!---->Bug: 1158266<!----></a><br><br>(cherry picked from commit <span class="line"><!---->(cherry picked from commit <!----></span>aedd4d97491936c57c45552dfeb8ea6ea985d26d<a class="undefined" target="_blank" I40bfc24ff5dcdb7a248114220100b6dd54ac06f4<span class="line"><!---->Change-Id: I40bfc24ff5dcdb7a248114220100b6dd54ac06f4<!----></span><br>Reviewed-on: <span class="line"><!---->Reviewed-on:         *** Boilerplate reminders! ***<span class="line"><!---->*** Boilerplate reminders! ***<!----></span><br>Please do NOT publicly disclose details until a fix has been released to all our users. Early public disclosure may cancel the provisional reward. Also, please be considerate about disclosure when the bug affects a core library that may be used by other products. Please do NOT share this information with third parties who are not directly involved in fixing the bug. Doing so may cancel the provisional reward. Please be honest if you have already disclosed anything publicly or to third parties. Lastly, we understand that some of you are not interested in money. We offer the option to donate your reward to an eligible charity. If you prefer this option, let us know and we will also match your donation - subject to our discretion. Any rewards that are unclaimed after 12 months will be donated to a charity of our choosing.<span class="line"><!---->Please do NOT publicly disclose details until a fix has been released to all our users. Early public disclosure may cancel the provisional reward. Also, please be considerate about disclosure when the bug affects a core library that may be used by other products. Please be honest if you have already disclosed anything publicly or to third parties. Lastly, we understand that some of you are not interested in money. We offer the option to donate your reward to an eligible charity. If you prefer this option, let us know and we will also match your donation - subject to our discretion. Any rewards that are unclaimed after 12 months will be donated to a charity of our choosing.<!----></span><br><br>Please contact <span class="line"><!---->Please contact <!----></span>security-vrp@chromium.org<a class="undefined" target="_blank" href="mailto:security-vrp@chromium.org"><!---->security-vrp@chromium.org<!----></a> with any questions.<span class="line"><!----> with any questions.<!----></span><br>******************************<span class="line"><!---->******************************<!----></span><mr-comment-content></mr-comment-content>

        Hello OP/emilykim@, we consider attachments/pocs included with reports to be an integral part of the report (<span class="line"><!---->Hello OP/emilykim@, we consider attachments/pocs included with reports to be an integral part of the report (<!----></span>https://bughunters.google.com/about/rules/5745167867576320<a class="undefined" target="_blank" href="https://bughunters.google.com/about/rules/5745167867576320"><!---->https://bughunters.google.com/about/rules/5745167867576320<!----></a>),<span class="line"><!---->),<!----></span> so I've undeleted them.            issue<h3 class="medium-heading"><!----> issue</h3>
          
            Target project:<label for="targetProjectInput">Target project:</label>
            
              <input id="targetProjectInput" aria-owns="chops-autocomplete-1" aria-autocomplete="both" aria-expanded="false" aria-haspopup="listbox" aria-activedescendant="">
              
      
        /*
         * Really specific class names are necessary because ShadowDOM
         * is disabled for this component.
         */
        .chops-autocomplete-container {
          position: relative;
        }
        .chops-autocomplete-container table {
          padding: 0;
          font-size: var(--chops-main-font-size);
          color: var(--chops-link-color);
          position: absolute;
          background: var(--chops-white);
          border: var(--chops-accessible-border);
          z-index: 999;
          box-shadow: 2px 3px 8px 0px hsla(0, 0%, 0%, 0.3);
          border-spacing: 0;
          border-collapse: collapse;
          /* In the case when the autocomplete extends the
           * height of the viewport, we want to make sure
           * there's spacing. */
          margin-bottom: 1em;
        }
        .chops-autocomplete-container tbody {
          display: block;
          min-width: 100px;
          max-height: 500px;
          overflow: auto;
        }
        .chops-autocomplete-container tr {
          cursor: pointer;
          transition: background 0.2s ease-in-out;
        }
        .chops-autocomplete-container tr[data-selected] {
          background: var(--chops-active-choice-bg);
          text-decoration: underline;
        }
        .chops-autocomplete-container td {
          padding: 0.25em 8px;
          white-space: nowrap;
        }
        .screenreader-hidden {
          clip: rect(1px, 1px, 1px, 1px);
          height: 1px;
          overflow: hidden;
          position: absolute;
          white-space: nowrap;
          width: 1px;
        }
      <style>

            </div>
          </div>

      <style>
        /*
         * Really specific class names are necessary because ShadowDOM
         * is disabled for this component.
         */
        .chops-autocomplete-container {
          position: relative;
        }
        .chops-autocomplete-container table {
          padding: 0;
          font-size: var(--chops-main-font-size);
          color: var(--chops-link-color);
          position: absolute;
          background: var(--chops-white);
          border: var(--chops-accessible-border);
          z-index: 999;
          box-shadow: 2px 3px 8px 0px hsla(0, 0%, 0%, 0.3);
          border-spacing: 0;
          border-collapse: collapse;
          /* In the case when the autocomplete extends the
           * height of the viewport, we want to make sure
           * there's spacing. */
          margin-bottom: 1em;
        }
        .chops-autocomplete-container tbody {
          display: block;
          min-width: 100px;
          max-height: 500px;
          overflow: auto;
        }
        .chops-autocomplete-container tr {
          cursor: pointer;
          transition: background 0.2s ease-in-out;
        }
        .chops-autocomplete-container tr[data-selected] {
          background: var(--chops-active-choice-bg);
          text-decoration: underline;
        }
        .chops-autocomplete-container td {
          padding: 0.25em 8px;
          white-space: nowrap;
        }
        .screenreader-hidden {
          clip: rect(1px, 1px, 1px, 1px);
          height: 1px;
          overflow: hidden;
          position: absolute;
          white-space: nowrap;
          width: 1px;

        <mr-related-issues id="reorder-related-issues"></mr-related-issues>

        mr-issue-page {
          --mr-issue-page-horizontal-padding: 12px;
          --mr-toggled-font-family: inherit;
          --monorail-metadata-toggled-bg: var(--monorail-metadata-open-bg);
        }
        mr-issue-page[issueClosed] {
          --monorail-metadata-toggled-bg: var(--monorail-metadata-closed-bg);
        }
        mr-issue-page[codeFont] {
          --mr-toggled-font-family: Monospace;
        }
        .container-issue {
          width: 100%;
          flex-direction: column;
          align-items: stretch;
          justify-content: flex-start;
          z-index: 200;
        }
        .container-issue-content {
          padding: 0;
          flex-grow: 1;
          display: flex;
          align-items: stretch;
          justify-content: space-between;
          flex-direction: row;
          flex-wrap: nowrap;
          box-sizing: border-box;
          padding-top: 0.5em;
        }
        .container-outside {
          box-sizing: border-box;
          width: 100%;
          max-width: 100%;
          margin: auto;
          padding: 0;
          display: flex;
          align-items: stretch;
          justify-content: space-between;
          flex-direction: row;
          flex-wrap: no-wrap;
        }
        .container-no-issue {
          padding: 0.5em 16px;
          font-size: var(--chops-large-font-size);
        }
        .metadata-container {
          font-size: var(--chops-main-font-size);
          background: var(--monorail-metadata-toggled-bg);
          border-right: var(--chops-normal-border);
          border-bottom: var(--chops-normal-border);
          width: 24em;
          min-width: 256px;
          flex-grow: 0;
          flex-shrink: 0;
          box-sizing: border-box;
          z-index: 100;
        }
        .issue-header-container {
          z-index: 10;
          position: sticky;
          top: var(--monorail-header-height);
          margin-bottom: 0.25em;
          width: 100%;
        }
        mr-issue-details {
          min-width: 50%;
          max-width: 1000px;
          flex-grow: 1;
          box-sizing: border-box;
          min-height: 100%;
          padding-left: var(--mr-issue-page-horizontal-padding);
          padding-right: var(--mr-issue-page-horizontal-padding);
        }
        mr-issue-metadata {
          position: sticky;
          overflow-y: auto;
          top: var(--monorail-header-height);
          height: calc(100vh - var(--monorail-header-height));
        }
        mr-launch-overview {
          border-left: var(--chops-normal-border);
          padding-left: var(--mr-issue-page-horizontal-padding);
          padding-right: var(--mr-issue-page-horizontal-padding);
          flex-grow: 0;
          flex-shrink: 0;
          width: 50%;
          box-sizing: border-box;
          min-height: 100%;
        }
        @media (max-width: 1126px) {
          .container-issue-content {
            flex-direction: column;
            padding: 0 var(--mr-issue-page-horizontal-padding);
          }
          mr-issue-details, mr-launch-overview {
            width: 100%;
            padding: 0;
            border: 0;
          }
        }
        @media (max-width: 840px) {
          .container-outside {
            flex-direction: column;
          }
          .metadata-container {
            width: 100%;
            height: auto;
            border: 0;
            border-bottom: var(--chops-normal-border);
          }
          mr-issue-metadata {
            min-width: auto;
            max-width: auto;
            width: 100%;
            padding: 0;
            min-height: 0;
            border: 0;
          }
          mr-issue-metadata, .issue-header-container {
            position: static;
          }
        }

        Email display settings<h2>Email display settings</h2>

        There is a setting<a href="/hosting/settings">setting</a> to control how
        your email address appears on comments and issues that you post.<p>There is a <a href="/hosting/settings">setting</a> to control how
        your email address appears on comments and issues that you post.</p>

        Project members will always see your full email address.  By
        default, other users who visit the site will see an
        abbreviated version of your email address.<p>Project members will always see your full email address.  By
        default, other users who visit the site will see an
        abbreviated version of your email address.</p>

        If you do not wish your email address to be shared, there
        are other ways to get
        involved<a href="http://www.chromium.org/getting-involved">get
        involved</a> in the community.  To report a problem when using
        the Chrome browser, you may use the "Report an issue..."  item
        on the "Help" menu.<p>If you do not wish your email address to be shared, there
        are other ways to <a href="http://www.chromium.org/getting-involved">get
        involved</a> in the community.  To report a problem when using
        the Chrome browser, you may use the "Report an issue..."  item
        on the "Help" menu.</p>


        
          
      
        <slot></slot>
      <button>
        <slot></slot>
      </button>
    
            Got it
          <chops-button>
            Got it
          </chops-button>
        <div class="edit-actions">
          <chops-button>
            Got it
          </chops-button>
        </div>
      <chops-dialog id="privacyDialog" forced="">
        <h2>Email display settings</h2>

        <p>There is a <a href="/hosting/settings">setting</a> to control how
        your email address appears on comments and issues that you post.</p>

        <p>Project members will always see your full email address.  By
        default, other users who visit the site will see an
        abbreviated version of your email address.</p>

        <p>If you do not wish your email address to be shared, there
        are other ways to <a href="http://www.chromium.org/getting-involved">get
        involved</a> in the community.  To report a problem when using
        the Chrome browser, you may use the "Report an issue..."  item
        on the "Help" menu.</p>


        <div class="edit-actions">
          <chops-button>
            Got it
          </chops-button>
        </div>
      </chops-dialog>

        <div class="dialog-content">
          <slot></slot>
        </div>
      <dialog class="dialog" role="dialog">
        <div class="dialog-content">
          <slot></slot>
        </div>
      </dialog>
    
        This site hosts public issues in public projects<h2>This site hosts public issues in public projects</h2>

        Unlike our internal issue tracker, this site makes most
        issues public, unless the issue is labeled with a Restrict-View-*
        label, such as Restrict-View-Google.<p>Unlike our internal issue tracker, this site makes most
        issues public, unless the issue is labeled with a Restrict-View-*
        label, such as Restrict-View-Google.</p>

        Components are not used for permissions.  And, regardless of
        restriction labels, the issue reporter, owner,
        and Cc'd users may always view the issue.<p>Components are not used for permissions.  And, regardless of
        restriction labels, the issue reporter, owner,
        and Cc'd users may always view the issue.</p>

        

        
          
      
        <slot></slot>
      <button>
        <slot></slot>
      </button>

          <chops-button>
            Got it
          </chops-button>
        <div class="edit-actions">
          <chops-button>
            Got it
          </chops-button>
        </div>
      <chops-dialog id="corpModeDialog" forced="">
        <h2>This site hosts public issues in public projects</h2>

        <p>Unlike our internal issue tracker, this site makes most
        issues public, unless the issue is labeled with a Restrict-View-*
        label, such as Restrict-View-Google.</p>

        <p>Components are not used for permissions.  And, regardless of
        restriction labels, the issue reporter, owner,
        and Cc'd users may always view the issue.</p>

          <chops-button>

        Setting Pri-1 to match security severity High. If this is incorrect, please reset the priority. Sheriffbot won't make this change again.<!----></span><br><br>For more details visit <span class="line"><!---->For more details visit <!----></span>https://www.chromium.org/issue-tracking/autotriage<a class="undefined" target="_blank" href="https://www.chromium.org/issue-tracking/autotriage"><!---->https://www.chromium.org/issue-tracking/autotriage<!----></a> - Your friendly Sheriffbot<span class="line"><!----> - Your friendly Sheriffbot<!----></span><mr-comment-content></mr-comment-content>
